solPickerGUI
Class AddConfigurationPanel

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JPanel
                  solPickerGUI.AddConfigurationPanel
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
public class AddConfigurationPanel
extends javax.swing.JPanel

$Id: AddConfigurationPanel.html,v 1.10 2009/08/14 21:13:33 tizatt Exp $ JPanel that allows the user to add a new Configuration Object to the program. The user can use check boxes to select the filters that he wants present in his configuration. The user can also use text fields to specify the parameters for these filters. If the text fields are left blank, then default values are used for the filters

Author:
Arjun Chandrasekhar
See Also:
Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

AddConfigurationPanel

public AddConfigurationPanel()
Default Constructor; Initializes all the labels, fields, and buttons. Adds ActionListeners to the enzyme buttons that allow the user to add enzymes to the list of enzymes, remove enzymes, and clear the enzyme list. Adds ActionListener to the Add Configuration Button that allows the user to add a Configuration Object to the list of Configurations

Method Detail

isValidSequence

private boolean isValidSequence(java.lang.String seq)
Checks if an enzyme sequence is a valid sequence. A valid sequence contains only Capital letters and only contains the letters A, C, T, and G.

Parameters:
seq - the Enzyme sequence
Returns:
true if the enzyme sequence is a valid sequence

initialize

private void initialize()
initializes all the JComponents that make up the final panel

isEmpty

Checks if a text field is empty

Parameters:
field - the text field to be checked for emptiness
Returns:
true if the text field is empty, false if it contains text

isDuplicateID

private boolean isDuplicateID(java.lang.String id)
Checks if a configuration ID is a duplicate ID (meaning there is a pre-existing Configuration that has that same ID)

Parameters:
id - the ID to be compared against all the Configuration ID's currently in existence
Returns:
true is there is a Configuration in existence whose ID is identical to the parameter

fieldsFilledProperly

private boolean fieldsFilledProperly()
Makes sure that all the text fields have proper input values. The user is permitted to leave fields blank (which would cause the program to use predetermined default values), but any fields that are filled must have valid numbers. For the Minimum and Maximum GC Percent fields, the number entered into the minimum GC percent field must be smaller than the number the number entered into the maximum GC percent field, and the user is not permitted to enter a value for one of the two fields. The Configuration ID field must have a valid, non-duplicate ID number entered; the user cannot leave it blank.

Returns:
true if all the necessary fields are filled, and all the fields that are filled contain valid input values

isValidInteger

private boolean isValidInteger(java.lang.String num)
Checks if a String is a valid integer

Parameters:
num - the String to be checked to see if it is a valid integer
Returns:
true if the String is a valid number that can be parsed into an integer, false if not

isValidDouble

private boolean isValidDouble(java.lang.String num)
Checks if a String is a valid floating point number (decimal)

Parameters:
num - the String to be checked to see if it is a decimal number
Returns:
true if the String is a valid number that can be parsed into a floating point number, false if not

Returns:
the list of Configurations

pickRandomColor

private java.awt.Color pickRandomColor()
Uses a Random Number Generator to generate four random floating point numbers and use these numbers as the Red, Green, Blue, and Alpha numbers for a new Color Object

Returns:
a Color Object with four random float variables used as the Red, Green, Blue, and Alpha parameters
